<<<api>>>: TypedArray.getString
<<<code>>>: for (int i = 1; i < 10; i++){
String str = "weblinks_" + i;
try {
details = getResources().getIdentifier(str, "array", getPackageName());
typedArray = getResources().obtainTypedArray(details);
for (int k = 0; k < typedArray.length(); k++) {
MenuItem = typedArray.getString(k);
if (k == 0) {
navDrawerItems.add(new NavDrawerItem(MenuItem));
}
}
} catch (Resources.NotFoundException e) {
// handle the exception
}
}

<<<explanation>>>: To retrieve a 2D array from an XML string resource in Android, you can use the following code:

String xmlString = getResources().getString(R.string.xml_resource_name);
TypedArray typedArray = getResources().obtainTypedArray(xmlString);
for (int i = 0; i < typedArray.length(); i++) {
for (int j = 0; j < typedArray.getDimensions(); j++) {
String item = typedArray.getString(i);
// do something with the item
}
}
typedArray.recycle();

Replace R.string.xml\_resource\_name with the actual resource ID of your 2D array XML string. This code will loop through each element of the 2D array and retrieve the string value for each element. You can then use the string value for further processing.
